text: [Applause]
this video is brought to you by
brilliant there's been no shortage of
spiderman cartoons
they've aired on different networks
through the years from ABC to MTV to
Disney XD and more they all really
reflect when they were made - so looking
back on them all most functions like a
crash course in the history of animation
on television so before I start I want
to say that in a way I value all of
these shows but come on we all know that
some are a little or a lot better than
others so I'm gonna dig in and rank them
from less than amazing to the absolute
best
[Music]
number nine spider-man unlimited so I
know this show has its fans and I'll
probably take a little heat for this but
man I do not like spider-man unlimited
innit
spider-man hitches a ride into space
where he finds himself on a planet in
the middle of a civil war involving
animal humanoid hybrids
if you're listening to that and thinking
huh that doesn't really sound like
spider-man
you'd be right that's my main problem
with this show everything that makes
spider-man spider-man is stripped away
leaving us with a series set on an alien
world that could feature literally any
superhero as its lead most of the old
cast from the 1994 series is gone
replaced with a bunch of goofy new
characters that Fox probably expected to
sell a lot of toys with well that didn't
really work out and the show was
cancelled before the first season even
finished I will say this for the show
though the animation was pretty slick
for TV in 1999 still the fact that this
doesn't even feel like spider-man to me
lands it pretty firmly at the bottom of
my list
number eight spider-man 1981 the 60s
cartoon doesn't exactly hold up that
well but it's definitely more fun to go
back and watch than this very boring
early eighties update it's not bad
exactly it's just totally uninspired you
can tell that the writers were really
just cashing a paycheck and the
animation is pretty dull as well overall
there's just not that much to say about
this one as an introduction to
spider-man in his world it probably did
a perfectly fine job for kids back then
but there's very little reason to go
back to it now unless you want to be a
total Spidey completest number 7
spider-man and his amazing friends
the second spider-man cartoon of 1981
and by far the more ambitious one
spider-man and his amazing friends gets
big points from me for being the first
spider-man show to really dive into the
larger Marvel Universe now it's not
great storytelling by any means but
amazing friends was trying to do so much
more than its companion solo show in
addition to introducing Iceman and
Firestar as co-leads and as Friends of
Peters from college it also had episodes
after doom the x-men and Captain America
it was even the first ever appearance of
Wolverine on TV yeah he has an
Australian accent for some reason but I
mean he's there
want a piece of fruit overall amazing
friends isn't a great show but it's far
more ambitious than the ones that came
before it and expanded the web-slinger's
world more than anyone had ever seen
outside of comics plus the episodes with
the evil video arcade machine video
master are pretty great number 6
spider-man 1967 so this is a weird one
because I debated putting this show both
at the bottom of the list or a little
closer to the top the thing is it's not
good but I kind of love it it's so goofy
and cheap-looking with storylines that
feel totally hallucinatory at times it
was also my first introduction to the
character I remember watching it I think
on VHS at a daycare when I was like four
or five and having my mind totally blown
looking at it now that's pretty hard to
imagine but still it's the show that
launched a thousand memes for a reason
it is really funny to watch now there's
absolutely no internal logic to it half
the time like look at this what is this
what am I looking at here I have no idea
but whatever it is I love it stiff
animation in all number 5 ultimate
spider-man so I think that in my video
about the newest spider-man show I said
that I liked ultimate more and I gotta
say going back and rewatching some
episodes for this video but I was wrong
I kind of can't stand this show now
don't get me wrong it looks good it's
got some solid voice acting and every
once in a while it has some really
decent joke writing but and keep in mind
this is coming from someone well outside
of its target demographic I just find it
really annoying like it gives me a
headache it's doing a very specific
thing and I guess it's doing that well
but that thing is just really not for me
now I've heard the later seasons improve
and I don't doubt that's true but this
version of Peter Parker just doesn't
really feel like Peter Parker to me
anyway I'll move on from this one since
I probably just sound like a cranky old
man right now number 4 Marvel spider-man
so remember how I said that the 1981
show wasn't terrible it was just kind of
boring and uninspired the most recent
spider-man series kind of feels like
that but for the 2010s now maybe that's
kind of harsh it's actually not bad
these days I think it's really improved
over the course of its run and it has a
big advantage over the much older shows
and that while I don't love the
animation it is inarguably more fast and
fluid resulting in some pretty good
action scenes as the show has gone on
the character work has improved as well
to the point where I actually kind of
liked this show now I don't ever see it
cracking the top three spots but I don't
think it's a bad watch either number
three spider-man the new animated series
2003 was a weird time for spider-man
his first movie had just come out a year
earlier and was a much bigger hit than
anyone expected
and suddenly the character wasn't just
an old icon he'd become a new phenomenon
which is probably why MTV of all
networks was eager to scoop up a new
animated show about his college
adventures acting as both this weird
quasi sequel to the first raving movie
and a very loose adaptation of the
Ultimate Comics the result was a show
that I don't think looks great today
due to some very dated CG but it was
very solidly written MTV was probably a
bad match for Spidey since the show only
lasted one season but it did allow the
writers to be much more mature than most
spider-man cartoons could ever be and
that really paid off as the show did a
lot of great stuff with Peter MJ and
Harry Osborn
it's really too bad that the animation
looks like it does and that it only
lasted one season because otherwise I
think this could have gone toe-to-toe
with the best spider sense tells me
[Music]
[Applause]
number two spider-man the animated
series what can I say about this show
that hasn't been said already it's a
classic and especially at the time it
blew away all other Spiderman
adaptations with ease with its long
winding story arcs and intense focus on
Peter as a character I think it's really
only beaten by Batman's animated series
as the best superhero cartoon of the 90s
these days it is easy to see the cracks
the animation is very stiff by today's
standards and some of the voice acting
can be unintentionally funny but overall
it still holds up as a pretty incredible
version of the webhead I think where the
show really shined was with its villains
with its versions of Hobgoblin and venom
being almost the definitive versions of
those characters in my mind like when I
picture venom to this day it's kind of
this venom that I'm thinking of I also
love that it's not afraid to get really
big in cosmic sure the episodes could
get clunky but they always took really
big swings also the show has an amazing
Jay jonah Jameson maybe the best ever
outside of JK Simmons I could honestly
talk about this show all day but I'll
try to move on to number one the
spectacular spider-man you probably
predicted this because yeah it is kind
of predictable but for me this is just
the best version of spider-man ever put
on TV so much care was put into the
writing of this show that it takes it
out of the realm of just being a good
kids cartoon and makes it a great TV
show period the dialogue is sharp the
plotting is perfectly paced and it's two
short seasons it's kind of hard for me
to find anywhere where it really tripped
up the animation might not be all that
much to look at when judging by screen
shots but it really shines in those
action scenes where all the money and
time saved by the more simplistic
designs really shows up on screen giving
us some of the most fast-paced and
thrilling spider-man battles I've ever
seen it may not have lasted long but in
its short time in the air I think it
really earned to the top spot on this
list one thing that's been really
interesting to see across all these
interpretations of Peter Parker even in
spider-man unlimited is how many of them
retain the characters love of science
and learning Peter Parker may not be
Tony Stark levels of insane genius but I
think he's
or grounded love of science is a lot
more relatable and maybe that's a big
part of why I enjoy brilliant so much
these last few weeks I've really been
digging into the science essentials
course I'm gonna be honest even though I
love it science was never one of my
strongest suits in school I was always
more of an English guy but that's
exactly what makes this course so great
it makes science approachable and fun in
equal parts I've had brilliant on as a
sponsor a few times and one thing that I
always want to touch on is how they
encourage a different way to learn
instead of just memorizing rote formulas
and having you solve problems with them
over and over again brilliant is always
surprising you but never forcing you
into boring repetition so it actually
makes it a really entertaining challenge
in addition to being a great way to
learn and if you think you're a little
bit beyond science essentials don't
worry because there is a ton of courses
on here to try out so to support the
channel and learn more about brilliant
go to brilliant org slash midnight and
sign up for free oh and also the first
200 people that go to that link will get
20% off the annual premium subscription
so I definitely encourage you to go over
there and check out all the courses they
have on offer new 1940 play Patrol you'd
better hurry up and join at once because
there's a big adventure ahead the thing
to do now is to get started because
we're going to have not only barrels of
